definition: half dead (of torment, hunger, tiredness etc)/(tired) to death/(terrified) out of one's wits/(beaten) to within an inch of one's life/(knock) the daylights out of sb
half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
to die/impassable/uncrossable/inflexible/rigid/extremely/damned

sentences.english: That thunderstorm the other night frightened little Tom half to death.
sentences.chinese: 前兩天晚上的那場雷雨把小湯姆嚇得半死。

sentences.english: Beat me half to death with it.

sentences.chinese: 你就看不出來它已經是半死不活了嗎？

sentences.english: We are scared half to death, and only on the one lesson a quick run.
sentences.chinese: 我們嚇得半死的，才上了一節課就趕緊跑了。

sentences.english: The man is more dead than alive.

sentences.chinese: 你不能有那種“半死不活”的銀行。”

sentences.english: I like you better now that you're dying.
sentences.chinese: 我真希望你現在半死不活。

sentences.english: Instant yong-shou Chen smell speech frightened to death.
sentences.chinese: 陳永壽聞言瞬間嚇的半死。

sentences.english: I would rather not take chances to be scared out of daylights.
sentences.chinese: 我不會冒險去被嚇個半死的。

sentences.english: The beggar was half-dead from hunger.
For scaring him half to death?
sentences.chinese: 感謝他們把自己嚇個半死？

sentences.english: The doctor revived a half-drowned person.
sentences.chinese: 醫生救活了一個淹得半死的人。

sentences.english: They stripped him of his clothes, beat him and went away, leaving him half dead.
sentences.chinese: 他們剝去他的衣裳，把他打個半死，就丟下他走了。

sentences.english: She has been appeared abruptly during the period of his room , he has been scared half-dead.
sentences.chinese: 她突然出現在他的房間時，他被嚇了個半死。

definition: unbearable/terrible/enough/unlikely
variant of 夠嗆|够呛[gou4 qiang4]
lit. to pour dog's blood on (idiom)/fig. torrent of abuse
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
to piss in one's pants in terror (idiom); scared witless
torrent of abuse (idiom)
a bloody nose and a swollen face/badly battered
to frighten/to scare
to scare/to intimidate/to threaten/(interjection showing disapproval) tut-tut/(interjection showing astonishment)
confused/distracted
while still alive/simply/totally
to infuriate/to be furious/to die from an excess of anger
to kill/to put to death
to beat up/to break to pieces
to be scared out of one's wits/to scare stiff
extremely/awfully
to hover between life and death (idiom)/to suffer terribly/within an inch of one's life
